para.remark: This document contains proposed additions/ modifictaions to version 1.4 of the VSIPL specification, namely the addition of a direct data access (DDA) API.

revision.revremark: Added fields to the vsip_dda_layout structure; changed the definition of VSIP_DDA_SYNC_POLICY_INOUT to leverage the IN and OUT policies.
Added storage format and dimension order types; updated the layout attributes to use the new types; change the layout attributes to a type-agnostic type

Copied the structure of chapter 2 to the draft; Split block layout types out into a separate section; Added an abstract pointer object for complex DDA pointers, with raw pointer accessor functions, and modified the complex pointer accessor accordingly; added more text to describe the storage format type; Made synchronization policy declarations constant; Added dimension type declarations; Packing and layout types no longer have DDA-specific names; shortened dimension type names

Moved the DDA API out into a separate chapter, left the block layout types in with the VSIPL types; Clarified the language with respect to the return value of the datagetattrib function; Added block length to the proxy object attributes in place of the view attributes; Removed the abstract pointer type and simplified the complex pointer accessor API accordingly.

Changed DDA objects to be built on top of view instead of blocks; Added a comment for discussion RE creation of the tuple type; Added a replaceable character "k" to type and function definitions to account for the associated view type.

Changed the name of the vsip_tuple type to vsip_dim_order; Added comments for consideration to the vsip_storage_format and vsip_cmplx_mem type definitions; Added a comment for consideration to the vsip_dim_order type definition; Added a table to the vsip_sync_policy type explanation to summarize the data flows and when to use each policy; Added a comment for consideration to the vsip_pack_type section.

Reverted the vsip_cmplx_mem type definition; Updated the vsip_storage_format definition to use the vsip_cmplx_mem values; Removed the table from the vsip_dda_sync_policy section so that the contents match those of the corresponding section in the VSIPL++ specification; Added aliasing rules, matching those in the VSIPL++ specification, to the synchronization policy section; Defined additional type-specific function prototypes; Removed TODO statements from example source code files; Added TODO statements to capture forward-looking and out-of-scope issues for the next RTF.
Fixed a bug in the return values of the vsip_dda_dkdatacreate_p() function; Added examples to the vsip_dda_dkcost_p(), vsip_dda_ckptr_as_array_p(), and vsip_dda_ckptr_as_interleaved_p() functions.

Moved vsip_cmplx_mem back to section 2.4, along with its deprecation warning; Added a note to vsip_storage_format regarding how the current literal definitions will be relaxed in a future version; Added the static keyword to vsip_dim_order and vsip_dda_sync_policy constant definitions to make them valid C constants; Assigned VSIP_STORAGE_FORMAT_ANY a value so that it would not conflict with VSIP_STORAGE_FORMAT_INTERLEAVED_COMPLEX; Added a note to vsip_dda_dkdatadestroy_p() regarding destruction of VSIPL space DDA buffers; Re-ordered the function sections; Collapsed the complex pointer type function definitions by adding the replaceable character q; Changed the word "interleaved" in function names to "inter"; Added a description of the VSIP_STORAGE_FORMAT_ANY storage format; Compressed the examples; Added referenences from empty examples sections to function sections that contain relevant examples.
